edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util
Class HTTPGet

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util.HTTPRequest
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util.HTTPGet
public class HTTPGet
extends HTTPRequest

Represents a GET request to an HTTP server. This class is used particularly in the edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend.www package to represent a call to a CGI-bin script on a web search engine.

Fields inherited from class edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util.HTTPRequest
cookie, url
 
Constructor Summary
HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString)
          Create the request, with a String URL that includes the parameters to the CGI script, e.g.:
http://www.searchme.com/search.cgi?title="things"
This class can also be used to just fetch a regular web page, e.g.:
http://www.searchme.com/index.html
HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString, java.lang.String paramString)
          Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.
HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString, java.lang.String paramString, boolean isAlreadyEncoded)
          Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.
HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString, java.util.Vector parameters)
          Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.

Constructor Detail

HTTPGet

public HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString)
        throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
               java.io.IOException
Create the request, with a String URL that includes the parameters to the CGI script, e.g.:
http://www.searchme.com/search.cgi?title="things"
This class can also be used to just fetch a regular web page, e.g.:
http://www.searchme.com/index.html
Parameters:
urlString - a String URL that includes the parameters to the CGI script

HTTPGet

public HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString,
               java.util.Vector parameters)
        throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
               java.io.IOException
Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name. Parameters are passed as name/value pairs in a Vector. So in this case the urlString might be:

http://www.searchme.com/search.cgi
Parameters:
urlString - a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.
parameters - a Vector of name/value vector pairs representing the parameters passed to the script

HTTPGet

public HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString,
               java.lang.String paramString)
        throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
               java.io.IOException
Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name. Parameters are in a String that is assumed to already be URL-encoded. So in this case the urlString might be:

http://www.searchme.com/search.cgi
And the paramString would be:
name=things+to+find
Parameters:
urlString - a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.
paramString - an already-URL-encoded String representing the parameters.

HTTPGet

public HTTPGet(java.lang.String urlString,
               java.lang.String paramString,
               boolean isAlreadyEncoded)
        throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
               java.io.IOException
Create the request, with a String URL that includes only the domain and script name. Parameters are in a String. The caller also indicates whether this String has been URLEncoded or not. So in this case the urlString might be:

http://www.searchme.com/search.cgi
And the paramString would be either:
name=things+to+find
Or:
name=things to find
depending on the value of isAlreadyEncoded
Parameters:
urlString - a String URL that includes only the domain and script name.
paramString - a String representing the parameters.
isAlreadyEncoded - whether paramString is already URL encoded or not.

Description copied from class: HTTPRequest
Return a BufferedReader representing the output of the response to the request. Can only be called once, and cannot be called after an invocation of HTTPRequest.getInputStream().
